Question: In 1946 when this person was 12, he moved with his father to Tehran, Iran.
Hints: Resistance was lighter than this person expected, and Iraqi troops surrendered in large numbers.
In 1992, this person published a memoir, It Doesn't Take a Hero, about his life; it became a bestseller.
In fact, this person believed extensive press coverage would help build public support for the war and raise morale.
